definition: to do less well than before/to make a concession/setback/backward step/leeway/room to maneuver/fallback
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: You've done a good job in the exam, I hope you won't backslide.
sentences.chinese: 你考试考得不错，我希望你不要退步。

sentences.english: That would be as big a setback as his rigged re-election in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 这一退步将跟他2009年依靠弊选连任一样糟糕。

sentences.english: We fear that she is regressing as her vocab is decreasing.
sentences.chinese: 我们担心，她是因为她的词汇退步正在减少。

sentences.english: He got backslidden but he has had a great turn.
sentences.chinese: 他退步了，不过后来有了很大的转变。

sentences.english: In this period, the measures of famine policy advanced or moved back in some prospects.
sentences.chinese: 此时荒政措施有进步之处也有退步的地方。

sentences.english: The act or an instance of lapsing, as.
The common saying that on the road to democracy there are vestigia nulla retrorsum is not universally true in America.
sentences.chinese: 民主路上无退步的论调美国并非普遍是正确的。

sentences.english: Russian football has taken a step backwards, " Hiddink said.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯足球已经退步了，”希丁克说。

sentences.english: This is what we mean by the retrogressive nature of Japan's war.
sentences.chinese: 这就是所谓日本战争的退步性。

sentences.english: And in our society today, no progress means to retrogress.
sentences.chinese: 在我们今日的社会里，没有进步就意味着退步。

sentences.english: I feel the website is entered paragraph did not get developing, be in instead degenerative.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得网站进段没有得到发展，反而在退步。

definition: to mark time (military)/to make no headway
to make progress/progress
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to fall back/to go in reverse
to advance by leaps and bounds
to be at a standstill/to mark time
to impede/to obstruct/to hold back
by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
to overtake
leeward/downwind/disadvantageous position/to concede or give way in an argument
to concede/to admit defeat
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to fail/to flunk
disparity/gap
bad/no good/below average/disappointing
to try hard to catch up
